isOpen.description: If `true`, the dialog will be open.

onClose.description: Callback invoked to close the dialog.

allowPinchZoom.description: Handle zoom/pinch gestures on iOS devices when scroll locking is enabled.

autoFocus.description:
If `true`, the dialog will autofocus the first enabled and interactive
element within the `DialogContent`

blockScrollOnMount.description: If `true`, scrolling will be disabled on the `body` when the dialog opens.

closeOnEsc.description: If `true`, the dialog will close when the `Esc` key is pressed

closeOnOverlayClick.description: If `true`, the dialog will close when the overlay is clicked

finalFocusRef.description: The `ref` of element to receive focus when the dialog closes.

initialFocusRef.description: The `ref` of element to receive focus when the dialog opens.

isFullHeight.description:
If `true` and drawer's placement is `top` or `bottom`,
the drawer will occupy the viewport height (100vh)

lockFocusAcrossFrames.description:
Enables aggressive focus capturing within iframes.
- If `true`: keep focus in the lock, no matter where lock is active
- If `false`:  allows focus to move outside of iframe

onCloseComplete.description: Fires when all exiting nodes have completed animating out

onEsc.description: Callback fired when the escape key is pressed and focus is within dialog

onOverlayClick.description: Callback fired when the overlay is clicked.

portalProps.description: Props to be forwarded to the portal component

preserveScrollBarGap.description:
If `true`, a `padding-right` will be applied to the body element
that's equal to the width of the scrollbar.

This can help prevent some unpleasant flickering effect
and content adjustment when the dialog opens

returnFocusOnClose.description: If `true`, the dialog will return focus to the element that triggered it when it closes.

trapFocus.description:
If `false`, focus lock will be disabled completely.

This is useful in situations where you still need to interact with
other surrounding elements.

ðŸš¨Warning: We don't recommend doing this because it hurts the
accessibility of the dialog, based on WAI-ARIA specifications.

useInert.description:
A11y: If `true`, the siblings of the `dialog` will have `aria-hidden`
set to `true` so that screen readers can only see the `dialog`.

This is commonly known as making the other elements **inert**

motionProps.description: The custom framer-motion transition to use for the dialog
